fields.description:
i set up various two-dimensional portlets where on my x-axis i have a custom field (issue type) and on the y-axis another custom field (module).  

I then set up a portlet for each version of my software release.  this way i can see how many issues i have for each module by type and version.  

what i would like is for values that don't have a number to still appear.  For example:

Say i have the following Modules in the database:

Module 1
Module 2
Module 3

Now on my report for all the issues by type for version 1.0 i have a grid that looks like this roughly:

                           Bug                    Enhancement
Module 1          2                         1
Module 2          3                         4
Module 3          1                         0

Now the issue arises when say Module 3 has no issues for this given version...Module 3 doesn't even appear on the report.  Similarly if there are no bugs for this version, that column doesn't even appear.

I would like it if they appeared but had 0 for a value.  This way the report looks the same all the time.  It's easier to copy & paste into excel if i need to.  i can just do more with it.  plus it looks cleaner. 

I'm attaching a screen shot of how it looks a little weird in my environment.
fields.summary: Do not remove values with no (zero) counts from statistics portlets

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-9624].
  {panel}

It would be nice if filters, as well as gadgets, could be specified with a "current project" value for the Project selection, and allow a dashboard to be associated with a project. Thus, you could:
- create one dashboard with many gadgets, some of them being based on filters, and then duplicated that dashboard for each project and simply change the associated project, without having to edit every single gadget and, even worse, recreating the filters so that they apply to the new project
- create generic fitlers whose output would depend on the current project (there is a notion of current project in Jira - for instance, when you click on Browse Project or when you do a quick search bug issue number)
- reports could also be generic, instead of forcing you to create a new filter for each project
fields.summary: Make use of the "current project" in filters and gadgets

fields.description:
Since we are working heavily with the linking cabability of JIRA we need a possibility to perform bulk tasks to all linked items per link type and link direction. Currently there exists no possibility to filter for instance for linked items in the issue navigator.  A user has currently only the possibility to see all linked items grouped by link-type and link-direction in the issue detail view (which is very perfect) or within ONE CELL a list of linked items in the 'linked items' column in the issue navigator, but there not grouped by link-type and direction. 

A possibel solution would be to have links in the issue view above the linked items (link-type and link-direction) which leads to the issue navigator with all the linked issue in the group of selected link-typs and/or link-direction. See my idea in the attached screen-shot!
This solution should be very cheap because JIRA already knows the needed queries for these selections being used in the issue detail views. I just guess that the only obstacle is that the issue navigator has no filter criteria for searchin for linked items. My idea here is to have following search capability in the issue navigator:

To search for linked items following search field-group is neccessary (inclusive some search scenarios):
Search for all items linked to issue JIR-1000 as 'duplicates' (the link direction is of relevance):
Issue-ID: JIR-1000
Link-Type: Duplicate
Link-Name: duplicates

or a search for all items being linked to issue JIR-1000 with the link-type 'Duplicate (the link direction isn't of relevance)
Issue-ID: JIR-1000
Link-Type: Duplicate
Link-Name: None

With best regards,
Alexander
fields.summary: Possibility to list all linked items in the issue navigator

fields.description:
For an enterprise level user like us JIRA 3.5 's missing granularity in permission schemes  is a hard blocker --- --- and there is no work-around.

There is a related recent issue here: JRA-5865. We voted for it.
But Atlassian's comment to it makes us believe that this issue does not get the priority it deserves.

That is why we would like to provide more detail and background:
==================================================

Like most enterprise project owners, we need to assign permissions per project, per group, per issue type. 
(Even your average CMS can do this today.) 

Want  a typical example ?
4 weeks ahead of a release deadline, the project manager wants to focus his/her developers on "wrapping up" and "cleaning up" tasks, and TEMPORARILY  prevent them from creating or working or resolving certain issue types, like "new features", which can be resumed AFTER the release.

Currently, JIRA cannot do this.

And what makes things worse: there is no work-around:

As far as I can see after several trials, none of the many Jira scheme mechanisms can help to implement such local temporary changes of project configuration:
- the change of permission scheme cannot be done on a per issue type basis
- theoretically, a bulk operation to change the priority of certain issues could be done, but this is irreversible and cannot prevent developers
- preventing visibility through the issue security scheme is neither practicable nor desirable
- when changing the workflow scheme, JIRA  forces an irreversible status conversion (understandably)
- changing the issue type scheme forces an irreversible conversion of existing issues to the new scheme type (looks like a JIRA conceptual flaw)
- also the issue type screen scheme is of no help, because it does not include control over functions like "resolve" (looks like a JIRA conceptual flaw).

Does anyone know a workaround to "emulate" permissions per issue type ?
fields.summary: Permissions Granularity

Or maybe you could include the whole plain text email version in a hidden HTML portion at the end of the email? That'd enable the filtering and the nice layouts..

fields.description:
Currently JIRA attempts to validate the issue's reporter when it is being moved. So if the original reporter doesn't have the create issue permission in the target project, then their reporter will be changed.

While this way maintains the integrity of the destination project (reporters always have the create permission), it's usually not that useful and not particularly intuitive. Generally, people want to keep the reporter data, even if the issue is moved.

This becomes an especially large problem when users are "deactivated" by having all their permissions removed, so that still have issues they reported even though they don't have the permission to. When doing things that trigger a bulk move like Issue Type Scheme migration, the reporter information for these issues are lost.

The reporter field should probably be excluded from the move process altogether.

(NB Not sure if a Bug or Improvment)
fields.summary: Reporter information can be lost when bulk moving issues

The caller column of the tables {{OS_CURRENTSTEP}} and {{OS_HISTORYSTEP}} should be the user who made the transition into the step or created the issue.

When a user creates an issue (regardless of who is placed in the reporter field), the caller should be the current remote user.

fields.description:
When iterating through a long series of filter results using the "Next" link in the upper right hand corner of each issue, the box in the upper right hand with "Return to Search", "Next" and so on links disappears.  Once this happens, I have to start over again with the "Find Issues" screen and pick up where I left off.  Reproducibility on this is 100% although the exact steps and number of attempts required appear to vary.  

Typical steps
1.  Generate a filter result set for issues assigned to me in a non-terminal state (in this case, roughly 200 issues are returned)
2.  From the filter results screen, drill down into the first issue
3.  Perform a workflow action and hit the "Next" link.
4.  Mix in a few records where you simply hit the "Next" link
5.  Repeat N times where N has been (for me) as small as 7 and as large as 35.

At some point, the control box simply isn't shown any more.
fields.summary: "Next" link disappears periodically when iterating through filter results

fields.description:
A project has a notification scheme that has the default entry for "Issue updated" but all notifications for "Issue Resolved" are removed.

If the issue is resolved, and at the same time the issue is assigned to somebody else, no email is sent. 

This is certainly incorrect because the result is different from what would happen if both actions are performed in two separate steps (either resolve first, then assign; or assign first, then resolve). The assignee would receive his email in this case, but not if everything is done at once.

JIRA should try each notification rule for all affected actions, not just one rule.

This is a critical problem because the customer relies on email for his internal workflow, so important tasks such as regression tests never start because the assignee does not get the notification email. Customer is quite upset.

This problem also exist in earlier JIRA releases.
fields.summary: issue is updated but no email is sent

fields.description:

  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-9587].
  {panel}

If you try running the jelly service new line characters are ignored.

A workaround is to use jelly variables. For example:
{code:xml}
<core:set> var="description">
This is a test
Line 1
Line 2
Line 3
</core:set>
<jira:CreateIssue description="${description}"/>
{code}

fields.description:
The following situation results in a NullPointerException
1.  Components exist in the system which do not have a "Component Lead" value set
2.  A notification scheme exists that makes use of the "Component Lead" notification
3.  An issue is updated in a manner that results in the "Component Lead" being notified

The resulting stacktrace is attached in the file "stacktrace.txt"

A quick glance would suggest that there may be a problem somewhere near:
com.atlassian.jira.notification.type.enterprise.ComonentLead - getRecipients(IssueEvent event, String argument)
- which is where a NotificationRecipient is created with a null User
fields.summary: Exception when null component lead notified of issue change

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-9567].
  {panel}

Hi!

I would like to request a new feature for JIRA: a SyncML server.

With a SyncML interface it would be possible to sync JIRA issues with
the task list of an electronic calendar or PDA / PIM application.

This would increase productivity in areas where employees use both
systems as their task lists could be updated automatically.

JIRA should name its tasks uniqely, so that it only syncs JIRA tasks and
not additional ones created by the user in their calendar task list.

Is such an interface possible?

A customer has requested that we add support for the Apache Authentication Scheme.

http://www.bugzilla.org/releases/2.20.1/release-notes.html:

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-9557].
  {panel}

For the datetime picker, Jira does not format the am and pm.

This means that in a language like Japanese the date time picker does not work.

For example Jira willl produce

*30/3月/06 12:39 PM* when it needs *30/3月/06 12:39 午前*

A quick workaround here is to use 24-hour time. To do this:
# Goto WEB-INF/classes/jira-application.properties
# Edit the date picker format lines to look like below:
{code}
jira.date.time.picker.java.format = dd/MMM/yy HH:mm
jira.date.time.picker.javascript.format = %e/%b/%y %H:%M
{code}
# Restart Jira
fields.summary: Date Time Picker has incorrect formatting fro Japanese

fields.description:

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-9554].
  {panel}

A custom has requested the ability to allow workflow paths to be based on specific field values. 

This would be made possible based on:

1) issue creation where specific field values would dictate the initial workflow status the issue was placed in upon creation; and
2) field value specified during workflow transition screen.

So depending on the field values the issue would move to the appropriate workflow status as configured by the user in a custom workflow.

Create workflow post-function that notifies a specific user based on custom field value

fields.description: Let's say I have a transisition which has no transition view (no screen).  I then edit the transition to change the name or the description fields.  In the editor, the drop-down for the transition view is often not set to 'None" by default.  It is usually set to the third entry in the list, if you count "None" as being the first entry.  Sometimes, it is set to the fourth entry in the list.  I am not able to reproduce this on demand, but it's happening a lot.  I'm editing all of the names and descriptions of the transitions to make everything consistent between workflows, and I noticed that a lot of transitions were set to "Resolve Issue" screen, and I wondered why.  Then I discovered this bug.  So, I've set most transitions to use a view screen, just to prevent further instances of this.
fields.summary: When editing workflow transition with no transition view, transition view is set (seemingly) randomly in editor screen.

fields.description:
I think the "Support Request" feature within JIRA's administration interface is great.  I only wish the email it sends to jira-support could be sent from a different user than the default outgoing email user.  

We use JIRA as a helpdesk ticket manager as well as a development issue tracker.  Accordingly, we've set the outgoing email address to match our incoming helpdesk mail handler queue.  That means that whenever someone at Atlassian replies to one of our support requests, an issue gets created in our helpdesk project regarding that issue.  This isn't terrible, since we usually just move the issue to our JIRA project (where we handle issues related to jira itself) and then link them to the issue we created on our end that corresonds with the support request.  

Hmm...  another way to deal with this would be the ability to associate a support request with an existing issue so that replies would be attached to the right issue.
fields.summary: Ability to override email address support requests are sent from

fields.description: I often use the support request screen rather than just send email to jira-support@atlassian because it automatically exports your data and attaches it.  It would be useful to be able to attach files (such as screenshot images, etc...) on this form.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-9533].
  {panel}

Currently each JIRA issue has a change log associated with it,  which displays the Field change information (ie. Status, Assignee, resolution). The change log tells which field has changed, when was it changed, what was the old value and what is the new value. Is this change log available via the SOAP API? 

For instance we have opened an issue LEH-1 and the status is Open.  After a week the issue status changed to Closed.  We need timestamps when such transitions occur. The issue might have been commented a number of times before and after it was closed. We dont need these intermediate timestamps.

LEH-1
Opened --------- March 2 16.30 2006
Say it was commented ------ March 3 16.30 2006
Closed---------------- March 6 16.30 2006
Commented---------March 7 16.30 2006

Our interest would be in dates when the issue status changes. (i.e. open<------->progress/close /[all other statuses]). Would it be possible to provide a  API for this information?


Can this be implemented in your next future JIRA release?
fields.summary: Add ability to retrieve change log and status change dates via the SOAP API

fields.description:
When changing the password in 'Profile' and clicking 'update' to save the new password, a popup menu is show with a couple of user names. The user is asked with the text 'Please confirm which user you are changing the password for' to select the right user. I am not sure but maybe all users with the same password or the same email adress are shown. Now I randomly select a user from the list of registered users shown in the popup and click 'update'. After logging out from jira and logging in again, jira suggests the old password, but to successfully login, you have to use the new one as assumed. If I try to login as the user I selected from the popup menu, jira suggests the new password (which I actually used for my own account) but to successfully login you have to use the old password (as assumed).
Two things should be changed:
The currently logged in user should not see other user names in the popup, for which he can change the password(no admin rights are granted to the sample user choosen). When logging in again Jira should suggest the new password for me and not for the user randomly selected.
fields.summary: Changing the password does not work as expected

fields.description:
It is possible to input float values into a custom field of type Number with any precision.
A maximum precision of 6 digits after decimal point is stored into the database.
I can recover the complete value if I ask for the XML view of the issue.
Any other view (Issue page, Navigation page, Word, Excel) show only a maximum of 3 digits
to the right of the decimal point.  The number is rounded up.

I have a big problem with this because I used a custom Number Field to store a revision number
containing a dot. I would like to change this number to a text field, but this means I'll lost all values
stored in the database, because I see no other way than deleting the field and creating it anew.
When I noticed that every number is rounded up to 3 digits after the decimal point it was too late.
3 digits is quite a little precision!  Why this limit?  Is there any workaround?

Regards                                          Bettina Zucker
fields.summary: Number custom field precision is 6 in db but only 3 in view

fields.description:
We had a user that was created by the CreateOrComment mail handler.  Since the handler sets the username of the user to be the email address and we use LDAP authentication, we later decided we needed to delete that user and re-add it with the username that matches his LDAP user.  I reassigned the issue that had been created along with the orignal user and changed the reporter to myself, so I could delete the user.  I then deleted the user.  

It so happens that there was a .vcf file attached to the original email and JIRA had dutifully attached it to the issue.  I discovered that, after deleting the user, every time the issue was viewed, errors were being written to the log.  Deleting the attachment fixed the problem.  

The functionality of JIRA appears to have been unaffected by this issue.  All the same, it seems that there are some vestigial connections to the deleted user that should be addressed at some point.

fields.description:
Hi

I am wondering if you can tell me if there is a way to create New Issue Types and assign these to specific jira projects ?

I have managed to Create the New Issue Types but they are being assiged to Global Projects and so are appearing on ALL Projects drop down list.  I only want these specific Issue Types to appear for a specific project.

Please let me know if this is possible and if so, How do I perform this ??

Thanks
Jenny
fields.summary: Project specific Issue Types

fields.description:
Once I have set "Chinese" as the location and default language in an English Windows 2000 Advanced Server. Then I installed JIRA Enterprise Standalone 3.5.0/3.5.1 using an external database (SQL Server 2000).

The problem is when JIRA is running as a service, the labels in user interface were mostly Chinese, whatever I have changed at the "Locale" setting in user preferences or / and at "Default Language" setting in general configuration, nothing happens to the labels user interface, always Chinese.

I have tried changing the location and default language of the Windows back to English, but it still doesnot work. Remote clients met the same thing.

*N.B:*  If the JIRA isn't running as a service, then it works OK. If I use an old JIRA version such as 3.4.3, it works ok as well.
fields.summary: User locale setting doesnot work when JIRA is running as a service.

fields.description:
If you have a text field like 'description' starting with an minus '-' or plus '+' sign, formatting in Excel no longer works.

This is because Jira believes that the fields refer to a number e.g. '-6' but instead sees '-x'. As a result it throws the error "Number Stored as Text" in the next column.

This error will then turn off all formatting in the later Excel cells and you will start to see some strange data. For example, date fields will not be formatted.
fields.summary: A text field starting with a minus or plus sign causes problems in Excel

fields.description:
It looks like the data-sources.xml file has been changed and is phasing out the *datasouce* tag. We need to investigate the new tag/s.

The change that I found was in OC4J 10.1.3.0.0
fields.summary: Document new data-sources.xml format for OC4J
Upgrade the subversion plugin to new version of the subversion tmate library so that it is compatible with subversion 1.3
